Cranston.Wedding Cake House (Providence, Rhode Is:
The Wedding Cake House (formally known as the Kendrick-Prentice-Tirocchi house), is a three-story historic house located at 514 Broadway Street in the Broadway-Armory Historic District of Providence, Rhode Island. Built in 1867 and occupied continuously until 1989, it has come to prominence in recent years after its contents were the subject of an exhibit at the Rhode Island School of Design Museum in 2001, and it has undergone a variety of restoration efforts since 2011.
Built in the Victorian Italianate style, it has been called Providence’s ‘consummate gingerbread house’.
